intro: Pedicularis parryi var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple monkeyflower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking purple to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged opposite along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
